channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2023101036
item.description:
Report X-2023101036

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-12
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was set upside down causing the cap to leak. QA was called, we cleaned up the spill with nuetralizer. We secured the package in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap leaked due to being put upside down DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed rightside up in a lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023100621
item.description:
Report X-2023100621

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-02
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The caps on three of the bottles came loose and an internal leakage occurred. The contents were then brought to QA to be worked on. DescribePack: The package was leaking. Once the package was opened, the caps on three of the bottles were noticed to be loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The contents were placed in a spill tote to minimize spillage
